MS MCQs

    Implement data binding in your Windows 10 application - Summary and knowledge check

    »

    1. What is data binding?

      A method of connecting your app to a database.

      A way to transfer data between the UI and the application’s code.

      Making sure that data does not change.


    2. Which interface do you have to implement to reflect the change of a C# property on the UI?

      System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged

      System.ComponentModel.IReflectPropertyChanges

      NotifyPropertyChanged

      System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged


    3. What do you have to do to transfer text entered in a text box to a C# string property through data binding?

      Define the binding in XAML with Mode=OneWay.

      Define the binding in XAML with Mode=OneWay, and implement INotifyPropertyChanged in code.

      Define the binding in XAML with Mode=TwoWay.

      Define the binding in XAML with Mode=TwoWay, and implement INotifyPropertyChanged in code.


    4. What do you need to do to display the objects stored in an IEnumerable collection in a list box?

      implement the System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged interface, and bind the ItemsSource of the ListBox to the collection.

      Bind the ItemsSource of the ListBox to the collection.

      Implement the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface, and bind the ItemsSource of the ListBox to the collection.


    5. You’re adding items to your collection while the app is running. How do you make the UI reflect these changes?

      Implement the System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface, and raise the PropertyChanged event every time a new item has beed added to the collection.

      Use the System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection class to store the collection of items.

      Implement the System.Collections.Specialized.INotifyCollectionChanged interface in your logic class, and raise the CollectionChanged event every time a new item has beed added to the collection.
